intro: Crepis cichorioides, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, low-growing stems and small, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and grasslands. Crepis cichorioides is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
